title: Registrar Office – Registration Deadlines
content: The Registrar's Office maintains the official academic calendar. Registration for fall and spring terms closes at 11:59 p.m. on the published deadline date. Students who miss the deadline must submit an add/drop form with advisor approval. The calendar also lists late registration penalties and appeal instructions.

title: Registrar – Ordering Official Transcripts
content: Official transcript orders are submitted through the secure transcript portal. Students authenticate with their university credentials, choose electronic or paper delivery, and pay a $10 fee per copy. Processing takes one to two business days. Unofficial copies are available instantly in the academic records tile.

title: Academic Advising – Appointment Scheduling
content: Advising appointments are scheduled through the Navigate Student app. Standard meetings last 30 minutes, and students may choose in-person or Zoom formats. The site includes directions for requesting accommodations and instructions for adding topics to the appointment notes so advisors can prepare.

title: Records Office – Course Withdrawal
content: To withdraw after the add/drop window, students download the Course Withdrawal form, gather instructor and advisor signatures, and submit the completed packet to Records before the posted deadline. The page explains how W grades appear on transcripts and outlines potential impacts to financial aid and international student status.

title: Financial Aid – Understanding Your Award
content: The financial aid status page walks students through reviewing outstanding checklist items, accepting loans, and verifying disbursement dates. Contact options include calling the office at (555) 123-4567 or emailing finaid@university.edu for personalized guidance.
